dcterms:description: The CARLA simulator provides a realistic and urban environment for training and testing self-driving models, enabling the testing of algorithms in safe and controlled environments without the risk of accidents.

dcterms:description: This dataset is used to evaluate lane detection accuracy performance under sensor blockage caused by heavy rain for autonomous vehicles in the CARLA simulator.
dcterms:title: CARLA (Car Learning to Act) Simulator

dcterms:description: This dataset focuses on deep reinforcement learning based control for autonomous vehicles in the CARLA simulator, providing a platform for training and testing various control algorithms.
dcterms:title: CARLA (Car Learning to Act) Simulator

dcterms:description: This dataset provides a survey of deep reinforcement learning techniques applied to autonomous driving, summarizing various approaches and methodologies.

dcterms:description: This dataset discusses deep learning techniques for obstacle detection and avoidance in driverless cars, providing insights into various methodologies.

dcterms:description: This dataset explores robustness in reinforcement learning applied to the CARLA simulator, focusing on enhancing the reliability of autonomous driving models.

dcterms:description: The CARLA simulator is an open urban driving simulator that provides a platform for developing and testing autonomous driving algorithms.

dcterms:description: This dataset presents a hierarchical architecture for sequential decision-making in autonomous driving using deep reinforcement learning.
